name: 狄雅南
objective: Unit Operation will be divided into three chapters:  Introduction to Engineering Principles and Units (Ch. 1), Principles of Momentum Transfer and Overall Balances (Ch. 2), and Principles of Momentum Transfer and Applications (Ch. 3).
schedule:
1st week: Introduction conservation momentum, mass, and energy
2nd week: Introduction to Engineering Principles and Units (Ch. 1)
3rd week: Conservation of Mass and Material Balances
4th week: Conservation of Energy and Heat Balances
5th week: Exercise and Review
6th week: Principles of Momentum Transfer and Overall Balances (Ch. 2)
7th week: General Molecular Transport Equation for Momentum, Heat, and Mass Transfer
8th week: Overall Mass Balance and Continuity Equation, Exercise
9th week: Overall Energy Balance and Momentum Balance
10th week: Midterm Exam
11th week: Shell Momentum Balance and Velocity Profile in Laminar Flow
12th week: Design Equations for Laminar and Turbulent Flows in Pipes
13th week: Principles of Momentum Transfer and Applications (Ch. 3)
14th week: Pumps and Gas-Moving Equipment
15th week: Non-Newtonian Fluids
16th week: Differential Equations of Continuity
17th week: Review and problems exercise
18th week: Final exam/Group presentations
scorePolicy:
Mid-term　　        　　　　                                35 %
Final Exam/group presentations 　　                45 %
Homework, Classroom participants (Q&A)　　20 %
materials:
1.　　Geankoplis, C. J., Transport Processes and Unit Operations, 4th Ed., Allyn and Bacon series in engineering, Boston, Massachusetts (1978).
2.　　McCabe, W. L., Smith, J. C., Harriott, P., Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering, 7th Ed., McGraw-Hill.
remarks:
